text: Ectopic expression of a conditional <extra_id_0> GATA-2 <extra_id_2> Protein <extra_id_1> / <extra_id_0> estrogen receptor <extra_id_2> Protein <extra_id_1> chimera arrests erythroid differentiation in a hormone - dependent manner .
The GATA factors are a family of transcriptional regulatory proteins in eukaryotes that share extensive homology in their DNA - binding domains .
One enigmatic aspect of GATA factor expression is that several GATA proteins , which ostensibly share the same DNA - binding site specificity , are coexpressed in erythroid cells .

To elucidate the roles of individual GATA factors in erythropoiesis , conditional alleles of <extra_id_0> GATA-1 <extra_id_2> Protein <extra_id_1> , <extra_id_0> GATA-2 <extra_id_2> Protein <extra_id_1> , and <extra_id_0> GATA-3 <extra_id_2> Protein <extra_id_1> were prepared by fusing each of the factors to the hormone - binding domain of the human <extra_id_0> estrogen receptor <extra_id_2> Protein <extra_id_1> ( <extra_id_0> ER <extra_id_2> Protein <extra_id_1> ) .
These GATA / <extra_id_0> ER <extra_id_2> Protein <extra_id_1> chimeric factors were shown to be hormone - inducible trans - activating proteins in transient transfection assays .

When stably introduced into primary erythroblasts or conditionally transformed erythroid progenitors cells , exogenous <extra_id_0> GATA-2 <extra_id_2> Protein <extra_id_1> / <extra_id_0> ER <extra_id_2> Protein <extra_id_1> promoted proliferation and inhibited terminal differentiation in an estrogen - dependent manner .

These phenotypic effects are specifically attributable to the action of ectopically expressed <extra_id_0> GATA-2 <extra_id_2> Protein <extra_id_1> / <extra_id_0> ER <extra_id_2> Protein <extra_id_1> because erythroblasts expressing exogenous <extra_id_0> GATA-2 <extra_id_2> Protein <extra_id_1> are constitutively arrested in differentiation and because erythroid progenitors expressing either Gal / <extra_id_0> ER <extra_id_2> Protein <extra_id_1> or <extra_id_0> GATA-3 <extra_id_2> Protein <extra_id_1> / <extra_id_0> ER <extra_id_2> Protein <extra_id_1> do not display a hormone - responsive block in differentiation .
Thus , the <extra_id_0> GATA-2 <extra_id_2> Protein <extra_id_1> transcription factor appears to play a role in regulating the self-renewal capacity of early erythroid progenitor cells .
